problem_text:
(R. Bieri, R. Strebel). Let o be an associative ring with identity distinct from zero. A group G is said to be almost finitely presented over o if it has a presentation G = F/R where F is a finitely generated free group and the oG-module R/[R, R]⊗Z o is finitely generated. It is easy to see that every finitely presented group G is almost finitely presented over Z and therefore also over an arbitrary ring o. Is the converse true?
Yu. I. Merzlyakov
answer: No, it is not true (M. Bestvina, N. Brady, Invent. Math., 129, no. 3 (1997), 445–470).
